reviews.review_msg:
Worst prof at SFU -unorganized, cancelled all the classes, crazy expectations and kept changing things with little to no notice which makes it impossible to get a good grade and has a million excuses as to why its not her fault

If you can - contact Dr. Begby (dept. chair) or email me danish_safer0k(at)iCloud. com and I can contact on your behalf

This is the worst nightmare class, with an equally nightmare instructor. Extremely disorganised is an understatement. Half the classes cancelled with little notice an even less regard. Expected everyone to cater to her multiple needs. Not professional. Not reliable, available, or supportive. Leaves everything to last minute, expectations unreal.
The most disorganized prof I ever had. Class was incredibly boring and a total disaster

While Prof Akins is nice and very knowledgable, half the lectures were cancelled and she is impossible to reach most of the time. She will go weeks without answering or just straight up not answer multiple emails that she SAID TO SEND HER.

She also will change assignments, criteria, etc and forget to post what those changes are until right before

Kathleen is amazing! Incredibly knowledgeable about the subject matter and is able to make it all interesting and engaging. Very supportive of group discussion and very willing to help students succeed in her class. Great class and great professor!
Tries to get help during office hours but Holly just asked me to read more stuff on my own. She does not care about helping students at all.
The grading felt pretty subjective. I don't think she actually read my entire assignment. The feedback seemed unrelated to what I wrote.

Be prepared to spend more than 20 or 30 hrs every week juggling through precis and discussion questions on top of dense historical material. You often get the grade and feedback for the precis you submit one month later, but no need to worry! Holly will graciously offer you the opportunity to write another precis as a substitute!

Phil is a very enthusiastic & intelligent prof. I especially appreciate the overload of comments he made to all my papers. He tends to talk 95% of the time in class, leaving little room for interactive discussions, though. And like many Philosophy prof., he may never appreciate/acknowledge an argument opposite to his - but does still let you speak.

He's smarter and more knowledgable then the average SFU philosophy prof.(which isn't saying much),but he can get a bit testy at times and sometimes seems to give students too much credit for their often times stupid commentary. He's also a little bit of a scatterbrain, so his course is a drag.
